SENT.plain: Swelling over the face in infancy may be caused by parotitis, abscess glandulae parotis, osteomyelitis, purulent lymph node, bone tumor or by infantile cortical hyperostosis (the Caffey-Silverman syndrome)
The case report shows the typical clinical, laboratory and radiographic changes seen in infantile cortical hyperostosis
It is a benign condition, often disappearing spontaneously but also cases of recurrence are known
The knowledge of the typical signs and laboratory findings enables the determination of a quick and reliable diagnosis
